page.title: 11Aunt Sally
page.content: Aunt Sally is a skittle type game played only in Oxfordshire. It has been played outside pubs for more than 500 years. To play the game you need an iron pole, a dolly and six sticks. The 3 foot pole supports the dolly or Aunt Sally which is painted white. The players throw the sticks underarm from a platform or hocking to the dolly 30 feet away. If the sticks knocks the dolly cleanly off the pole it is scored as a strike and a miss is a blob. When the eight people in each team have thrown their sticks the scores are added up for each leg or horse. There are three horses to a game but sometimes a fourth round or beer leg is played. Aunt Sally is taken very seriously in this area. Many pubs have players registered in area league. The season is from April to September.
